p: In addition to their regular activities, pharmacists are well equipped to educate the community about the nature of the pandemic, symptoms, mode of transmission, promoting prevention and infection control procedures in line with the public health guidelines. Pharmacists are involved in identifying patients with symptoms and act as a point of referral at the community level. Adequate understanding of the symptoms of COVID-19 and being able to differentiate these symptoms from seasonal influenza is instrumental in early detection and referrals for further assessment, as required. This involves team-based care and proactively collaborating with other health workers within the pharmacist scope of practice whilst performing additional responsibilities.
